articles.title: How long will Mass. residents have to wait until their power is restored?
articles.description:
“The last couple customers, unfortunately, will be a couple days out,” said Doug Foley, President of Electric Operations at Eversource.

The post How long will Mass. residents have to wait until their power is restored? appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Eversource estimates power restoration for last customers will take a couple more days.
Doug Foley, Eversource President, addressed ongoing outages affecting Massachusetts residents.
Residents should prepare for continued disruptions in service and potential inconveniences.

articles.title: Trump uses longest-ever State of the Union to try to convince voters that US is ‘winning so much’
articles.description:
His main objective was convincing increasingly wary Americans that the economy is stronger than many believe, and that they should vote for more of the same by backing Republicans during November’s midterm elections.

The post Trump uses longest-ever State of the Union to try to convince voters that US is ‘winning so much’ appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Trump delivered the longest State of the Union address on February 24, 2026.
He aimed to sway voters ahead of the November midterm elections.
Boston residents may feel pressure to support Republicans for continued economic growth.

articles.title: 15 prospects Patriots fans should know entering the 2026 NFL Combine
articles.description:
More than 300 prospects will be on site in Indianapolis for the 2026 NFL Draft Combine.

The post 15 prospects Patriots fans should know entering the 2026 NFL Combine appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Over 300 NFL prospects will attend the 2026 Combine in Indianapolis.
Patriots fans should focus on 15 key prospects for potential draft picks.
The Combine influences the Patriots' strategy for the upcoming 2026 NFL Draft.

articles.title: Malden school employee on leave after alleged ‘serious incident’ involving high school student
articles.description:
The details of the alleged incident have not been disclosed, but the employee is on leave as a cautionary measure.

The post Malden school employee on leave after alleged ‘serious incident’ involving high school student appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Malden school employee placed on leave following serious incident with a high school student.
Details of the incident remain undisclosed; precautionary measures taken for student safety.
Local parents express concern over student safety in Malden schools amid ongoing investigation.

articles.title: These Mass. schools are closed for Wednesday, Feb. 25
articles.description:
Some Mass. schools will remain closed on Wednesday as the region digs out from a historic snowstorm.

The post These Mass. schools are closed for Wednesday, Feb. 25 appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Massachusetts schools closed on Wednesday, February 25, due to a historic snowstorm.
Boston Public Schools announced closures affecting thousands of students and staff.
Residents should prepare for continued disruptions in transportation and services.

articles.title: MBTA to (mostly) resume normal weekday service after historic blizzard
articles.description:
Aside from one Commuter Rail line, the MBTA’s various lines should be back on track Wednesday.

The post MBTA to (mostly) resume normal weekday service after historic blizzard appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: MBTA will resume normal weekday service on February 28, 2026, after blizzard disruptions.
All lines are operational except for one Commuter Rail line affected by the storm.
Boston residents can expect improved transportation options for work and school commutes.
